lead_paragraph: A judge has approved a deal for Volkswagen to buy back or fix vehicles affected in the emissions-cheating scandal.

headline.print_headline: Deal Is Approved for Owners of Diesel Volkswagens in U.S.
headline.main: Relief at Last for U.S. Owners of Diesel Volkswagens

snippet: A judge has approved a deal for Volkswagen to buy back or fix vehicles affected in the emissions-cheating scandal....
abstract: Judge Charles Breyer of United States District Court in San Francisco gives final nod to plan which will help owners of almost half-million Volkswagen diesel cars rigged with emissions-cheating software; agreement calls for Volkswagen to spend $10 billion to buy back or fix those cars and $4.7 billion on environmental projects; officials and analysts predict most owners will choose sell back option, in which company will pay full market value along with up to $10,000 in compensation, since it may take over year to develop and implement fix.
